A Cameroonian soldier was killed and 10 Chinese nationals were feared kidnapped after an overnight attack in northern Cameroon believed to have been carried out by Boko Haram militants from Nigeria , police said at the weekend .
One Cameroonian soldier was killed , said the police source , correcting an earlier statement that said a Chinese national died in the attack .

The Boko Haram militants were heavily armed , they came in five vehicles , an official in Waza , near the site of the attack in a northern Cameroonian region near the Nigerian border , told AFP on condition of anonymity .
